edge: Former bearer of the One Ring, captures Gollum and allows him to guide them as they are being tracked in the Emyn Muil near Mordor.
Lost in the Emyn Muil near Mordor while being tracked by Gollum.
Trying to infiltrate Mordor with the help of Gollum after being lost in the Emyn Muil near Mordor.
Escaped into Fangorn Forest from a band of Uruk-hai during a raid by a group of Rohirrim.
Pursued a band of Uruk-hai to save their companions, Merry and Pippin.
Leads a group of Rohirrim who have been exiled by Rohan's king, Théoden.

Is under the control of Saruman and his servant Gríma Wormtongue.
Believes Merry and Pippin were killed during the raid but leaves Aragorn's group with two horses.

Evacuates Rohan's citizens to the fortress of the Hornburg at Helm's Deep.
Departs from after encountering Aragorn's group in Fangorn Forest.
Helm's Deep is a fortress located in Rohan, where Théoden evacuates his citizens during the attack by Saruman's Orcs.
Théoden is the king of Rohan who evacuates his citizens to Helm's Deep during the attack by Saruman's Orcs.
Saruman's Orcs attack Rohan, forcing Théoden to evacuate his citizens to Helm's Deep.
Aragorn befriends Théoden's niece, Éowyn, and later falls from a cliff during the attack on the refugees travelling to Helm's Deep. He is found by Théodred's horse Brego and rides to Helm's Deep.
Éowyn becomes infatuated with Aragorn after he befriends her in the context.
Théodred's horse Brego finds Aragorn after he falls from a cliff during the attack on the refugees travelling to Helm's Deep.
Galadriel of Lothlórien convinces Elrond that the Elves should honour their alliance to men during the context.
Elrond informs Arwen that Aragorn will not return in the context.
Treebeard meets Merry and Pippin in Fangorn during the context. Convinced that they are allies, he brings them to an Ent Council.
Merry and Pippin witness Saruman's deforestation efforts in Isengard during the context.
Enraged by what he sees, Treebeard and the Ents storm Isengard during the context and trap Saruman in his tower.

edge: passing through the besieged city of Osgiliath, Frodo tries to explain to Faramir the true nature of the Ring
Frodo is fighting to save Middle-earth from the corrupting influence of the Ring.
Sam saves Frodo when he is in danger, demonstrating his loyalty and devotion to Frodo's cause.
Feeling impressed by Frodo's resolve, Faramir releases him rather than keeping him captive.
Determined to reclaim the Ring after feeling betrayed by his capture, Gollum decides to lead Frodo and Sam to Shelob.
By releasing Frodo and Sam, Faramir demonstrates his allegiance to the good still left in Middle-earth.
